item.title: Intel x86 Assembly Overview
item.author: philmish
item.description: This is an overview over the relevant basics of Intel’s x86 Assembly language. Architecture follows Van Neuman architecture Hardware components: CPU, RAM, I/O bitness: little endian Figure 1. Simplified Hardware Layout Main Memory Layout Data: also called data section, put in place when the program is initially loaded, the values contained in data may not be changed (static) and are available to every part of the program (global) Code: includes the instructions fetched by the CPU to execute the program, controls how the program’s tasks are orchestrated Heap: is used for dynamic memory during execution, changes frequently while the program is running Stack: is used for local variables and function parameters, helps control flow Figure 2.
